text: The Martha Heasley Cox Center for Steinbeck Studies is an internationally recognized research center dedicated to the life, works, and legacy of American author John Steinbeck. Located at San José State University in San José, California, it houses an extensive archive of Steinbeck's manuscripts, letters, and memorabilia, making it the largest Steinbeck collection in the world. == History == The center was established in 1971 by Martha Heasley Cox, a professor of English at San José State University, with the mission to preserve and promote the study of Steinbeck’s works. Over the years, it has become a hub for scholars, educators, and readers interested in Steinbeck’s contributions to literature and culture. In 1998, the center was officially named after its founder in recognition of her significant contributions to its development. == See Also == * John Steinbeck * San José State University * American Literature == References == == Other websites == * Official Website * National Steinbeck Center Category:Research organizations in the United States Category:1971 establishments in California
